Video calling is a commodity. the differentiation is the UX (and today Google has the worst UX). But fixing that is table stakes. Is there a point of leverage somewhere else in the stack? if not calendar, where?

Another path is to relocate this to a new app - to change the model and do it in Slack, say. But Slack is inherently internal - you can't use it across orgs. But calendar (like email) is a cross-org, cross device substrate. You can't change it, but you could change the client...

So far Google has mostly handled this by breaking it: squirting random unwanted hangouts links into invites; mangling the notes field, opening the phone number in the location field in Maps(!) And calendar innovation is constrained by interoperability - you can't add new fields.

Google and MSFT dropped the ball on video calls. But between them they own the calendar (especially Google outside legacy orgs), and it's often the calendar that controls the call. The calendar is the aggregation layer for video calls - tap a link and the right app opens

the unemployment contagion has started, with laid-off white-collar workers with 3-9 nine months of runway saying "I better cut all spending in case I don't find another high-paying job"

This result? MORE waiters, domestic workers & retail workers losing jobs--it's acute now.

What I'm seeing inside of small & mid-sized companies is SCARY

The economic collapse has moved from retail workers & waiters on to high-paid, white-collar workers (think Airbnb), & those workers, in turn, hire childcare, go on vacation, hire  tutors & go to restaurants obviously

An unemployment contagion has started

Stimulus must start on Mainstreet & be sustained for workers--NOT giant companies that didn't manage finances properly (ie airlines)

Unemployment must be extended & raised. People who made $800-$1.5k a week can't get by on $400 (more)

How to build a solid mock API:

1. Create mock data that covers all use cases
2. Create mock endpoints that mimic the real api
3. Create dev tools (to change mock responses)
4. Configure app to call mocks

The benefit: I can write fast, reliable, comprehensive integration tests.

Put another way: any organization capable of erecting a semi-permeable membrane between millions of seniors and others such that they could live normal-ish lives without getting the virus would be able to do the same thing for the rest of society.

And we can't do that.

Getting herd immunity may not work.

It may just make the virus endemic.

And if you make the virus endemic you won't be able to "protect seniors" or any other vulnerable group.

That may be how things land up, but let's not kid ourselves about what that outcome means. https://t.co/jHgv8ilLT0
